p: The risk of infection observed in RA patients treated with bDMARDs is generally considered slightly higher (from 1.5- up to 2-fold) compared with csDMARDs [ 27, 54]. This evidence recurred in most RCTs [ 55] and observational registry studies [ [56], [57], [58]] and was confirmed by a recent meta-analysis which showed that this risk is progressively increasing in relation to the use of bDMARDs at higher than recommended dosages [ 59]. Following the results of comparative metanalyses and real-life studies, abatacept is accepted as the safest bDMARD in terms of infectious risk [ 60, 61].
